lexUnit.name: sober.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: not affected by alcohol; not drunk

sentence.text: It seemed that Maidstone , who had been completely sober at ten o'clock when he left the bar , returned at about midday , still sober , but immediately started drinking heavily .
But in all that time I 've never been completely sober . "
If I were completely sober I might just manage to get you back to Brides Haven , but I doubt it .
Not entirely sober one evening in 1832 , Turner entered a Preston temperance meeting for a joke but came out converted .
In fact , the only men in the Chamber who seemed entirely sober were the Prime Minister and Halifax , his Foreign Secretary .
An official of the American Civil Liberties Union has protested : ` Firing people who come to work sober because of their condition on Saturday night is of debatable value . "
Even if one accepts the figures , it is apparent that four out of five fatal accidents are caused by people who are stone-cold sober .
But I 've never been able to write except when I was stone cold sober .
` So , " Benjamin continued , ` I am stone sober , taller than Waldegrave , and I find it difficult .
She would have reacted in exactly the same way if she had been stone-cold sober and standing in a bare room under a fluorescent light .
Usually , Jay was studiously sober at the beginning of an evening with Lucy .
Modigliani arrived quite sober for the occasion but when the two painters came to discuss their work the conversation became dangerously frigid .
Anyway , I 've been sober for a couple of days now and it changes your perspective a bit .
But still he says he would not be married or sober without the incident .
He is a really sober person , he ca n't handle a drink at all .
A sober soldier is a rarity indeed . "
It made him feel chilled and sober , as if the love and vodka had never been .
He was sufficiently sober by now to know that it was necessary to drive with extra care -- but not to appear too careful .
